attributes.action: stop airlines from claiming staff sickness is an extraordinary circumstance
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Under the terms of EU Regulation 261/2004, airlines can avoid paying compensation to passengers for a cancelled flight if they can claim that the cancellation was caused by "extraordinary circumstances". Airlines have taken it upon themselves to declare staff sickness as an extraordinary circumstance. The government must make it clear to airlines that they are responsible for their staffing and they cannot claim sickness as an extraordinary circumstance.
